newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Doctor warns of Hong Kong handover hysteria.
newsitem.headline: Doctor warns of Hong Kong handover hysteria.

text.p: The handover of this British-ruled territory to China on July 1 might trigger hysteria for some people, a local psychiatrist said.
Psychiatrist Doctor Orlando Tang said the historic moment might prove as traumatic as the death of a parent or the loss of a job for some people, the South China Morning Post said on Saturday.
Mentally unstable people could find the event traumatic, the Post quoted Tang as saying.
"The problem will be associated with those who are vulnerable or those who were ill before, with the event, precipitating a relapse," said Tang, head of psychiatry at a Hong Kong hospital.

A Hospital Authority executive said such an eventuality had been prepared for. All doctors in public hospitals had psychiatric training and specialist teams would be on call in case of major problems.
To cope with an expected surge in patients during the handover the newspaper said staffing at accident and emergency wards would be increeased by five to 10 percent.
